channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Do you love customers? Senior Perl Developer with a product focus, London
item.description: Ever find yourself wishing you could see meaningful impact on users from your work? Trapped in a company with long release cycles and dubious release dates? Wish your ideas for product improvement didnâ€™t keep disappearing in to the Project Managerâ€™s backlog?

item.title: Sprechen Sie Deutsch und Perl flieÃŸend? MÃ¶chten Sie in London leben?
item.description: Do you speak German, Perl, and passable English? My London-based client is interested in native (or near-native) German speakers who are interested in relocating to London (to join an English-speaking team).

item.title: Fully remote, committed Senior Developer based in the US or Canada
item.description: All-star Perl team in the US looking for fulltime remote Perl developer based in the US or Canada to work on their SaaS platform.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Symbolic XOR
item.description: New Perl blogger morandimus muses about something missing from Perl...

item.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: January 2, 2017 - January 8, 2017
How companies can help employees contribute to open source
item.description: Regular contributions to open source projects is widely known by developers to be good for the resume--but not all companies are as encouraging about open source participation as they could be. In this article from Opensource.com, Neeraj gives tips for companies wanting to help employees contribute, and find better balance in their lives.

item.title: Tips for non-native English speakers working on open source projects
item.description: From Opensource.com, Masayuki Igawa shares challenges and solutions for non-native English speakers who wish to contribute to open source, focusing on the OpenStack community, but the principles map well to other communities!

item.title: The Perl Conference 2017 CFP
item.description: The CFP for The Perl Conference 2017 in DC remains open until March 6, so get your presentation ideas turned in right away at http://www.perlconference.us/tpc-2017-dc/cfp/! The conference will be held June 18-23.

item.title: #286 - CFP of The Perl Conference 2017
item.description:
Happy Monday!

It's a little bit of a slow news week--which is fortunate for me, since it's been crazy busy elsewhere in my life! Here are a few bits from around the web for this week. As many of you know, I also write at Opensource.com, and we had a couple of articles this week that I thought might be of interest to Perl folk as well.
